3: It seems like we failed to bring down Babylonia.
That's fine. I've never wanted to end human suffering that way, anyway.
When a plan fails, we just move on to the next one.
I have all the time in the world now that I'm behind the scenes.
So are you still trying to think of a way to kill all humans in an instant without putting them through pain?
I would have said 'yes' in the past without a moment's hesitation.
But after what happened this time, I can't be so sure anymore.
Is it because of that team?
Yes. I thought they would choose to save more people and avenge those who died at the hand of their enemy.
But they chose a totally different path and missed such a perfect opportunity.
They've paid such a heavy price for their choice and lived through such pain, but they still stay on the frontline of the war and never give in.
They are so miserable and fragile, yet they still shine in all their beauty.
Old ideas probably aren't meant to work anymore.
It's probably time that we adjust Tabula Akasha accordingly.
(Nods) I think you'll find your answer.
No matter what happens, you will always have our support.
...Thank you.
Well... Let's put aside these issues with humans for now.
Luna must be eliminated no matter how Tabula Akasha evolves.
Let's see through our deal first, little Murray from Babylonia.
